page.title: 03 POPULATION CHANGES
page.content: "There have been many new people coming to this area in the last 15 years, mainly retired people. This has probably been the result of homes being cheaper here than in the south-east of England. Retired people come here from selling their dearer houses and topping up their pensions with the resulting surplus. You can probably restrict progress but I don't think you can stop it. It is probably a pity to see good arable land being used and yet on the other hand the district needs newcomers and likes to have them. I think what should be done wherever possible is that old sites should be re-used before they break into new land."
